original: @54b # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @54b # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ka l'a pa s'u tra sam bandha sy'a tra sam badnha sy'a di bi bha kti pra kri ya /
analyzed: ka l'a pa s'u tra sam bandha sy'a tra sam badnha sy'a di bi bha kti pra kri ya /
translated: Kalāpasūtrasaṃbandhasya ṣaṭpādādivibhāgaḥ prakṛtiḥ.

original: bod skad du //
analyzed: bod skad du //
translated: In Tibetan:

original: ka l'a pa'i mdo dang 'brel ba'i si la sogs pa'i rnam dbye'i bya ba //
analyzed: ka l'a pa'i mdo dang 'brel ba'i si la sogs pa'i rnam dbye'i bya ba //
translated: Kalāpasūtra dang 'brel ba'i sa la sogs pa'i rnam dbye'i bya ba.

original: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Lord of Speech, the Blessed One.

original: gdong bzhi gdong gi zla ba las //
analyzed: gdong bzhi gdong gi zla ba las //
translated: From the moon of the four-faced one

original: 'byung ba bdud rtsi'i rba rlabs can //
analyzed: 'byung ba bdud rtsi'i rba rlabs can //
translated: Arises the nectar-wave

original: shin tu mkhas pa'i ngag gis 'dir //
analyzed: shin tu mkhas pa'i ngag gis 'dir //
translated: Of the very wise speech.

original: zhi ba dam ba thob gyur cig /
analyzed: zhi ba dam ba thob gyur cig /
translated: May it bring about the attainment of the highest peace.

original: brjod par bya ba grags pa'i sgra rnams ni //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba grags pa'i sgra rnams ni //
translated: The words that are to be expressed,

original: skyes pa ma ning bud med rnams la yang /🔽yon tan rdzas dang bya ba sbyor ba las //
analyzed: skyes pa ma ning bud med rnams la yang / yon tan rdzas dang bya ba sbyor ba las //
translated: Whether masculine, neuter, or feminine,🔽Are explained as being common

original: de rnams thun mong gyur pa bshad par bya //
analyzed: de rnams thun mong gyur pa bshad par bya //
translated: To qualities, substances, and actions.

original: s'u rya dan aagni dang sa khi dang pa ti dang panthi dang aadshu dang kro shtu dang sva yambh'u dang pi tri dang nri dang bra shasti dang ree dang go dang gloo rnams ni dbyangs mtha' can rnams te skyes pa la bzhad par bya'o /
analyzed: s'u rya dan aagni dang sa khi dang pa ti dang panthi dang aadshu dang kro shtu dang sva yambh'u dang pi tri dang nri dang bra shasti dang ree dang go dang gloo rnams ni dbyangs mtha' can rnams te skyes pa la bzhad par bya'o /
translated: Sūrya, Dhana, Agni, Śaka, Pati, Panthī, Aṣṭa, Kroṣṭṛ, Svayambhū, Pitṛ, Nṛ, Praśasti, Rei, Go, and Lo are those ending in vowels. They are to be used for males.

original: gsal byed kyi mtha' can rnams bi aambu mutsa dang kshm'a bhu dzra dang ma rut dang kra byad dang mri g' bidha dang aat ma na dang r' dzan da yu ban dang p'u sha na dang bra hma han dang ha lin dang au sha na sra dang aa
analyzed: gsal byed kyi mtha' can rnams bi aambu mutsa dang kshm'a bhu dzra dang ma rut dang kra byad dang mri g' bidha dang aat ma na dang r' dzan da yu ban dang p'u sha na dang bra hma han dang ha lin dang au sha na sra dang aa
translated: Those ending in consonants are Vambumuc, Kṣmābhaja, Marut, Krabhya, Mrīgāvid, Ataman, Rājandayubha, Pūṣan, Brahmāhan, Halin, Uṣaṇasra,

original: na dv'e ha dang ma dhu li ha dang kshtha haksha zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: na dv'e ha dang ma dhu li ha dang kshtha haksha zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Anadvīha, Madhūliha, Kṣṭhahakṣa, and so on.

original: si la sogs pa'i mtha' can rnams byis pa rnams byis pa rnams kyis bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: si la sogs pa'i mtha' can rnams byis pa rnams byis pa rnams kyis bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Those ending in si and so on are to be explained correctly for the sake of distinguishing the childish from the childish.

original: de la s'urya'i sra ni byings dang rnam dbye bor ba'i don dang ldan pa rtags so zhes pas rtags kyi ming can no //
analyzed: de la s'urya'i sra ni byings dang rnam dbye bor ba'i don dang ldan pa rtags so zhes pas rtags kyi ming can no //
translated: Therefore, it is called a sign.

original: de las pha rol rnams rna dbye'o zhes pa ni dang po la sogs pa'i rnam dbye bdun po rnams la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las pha rol rnams rna dbye'o zhes pa ni dang po la sogs pa'i rnam dbye bdun po rnams la 'gyur te /
translated: The seven case endings, beginning with the first, are formed from that.

original: don shin tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir zhes pas rnam dbye'o //🔽de la si aoo dzas dang po'o / aam aoo shas gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: don shin tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir zhes pas rnam dbye'o // de la si aoo dzas dang po'o / aam aoo shas gnyis pa'o //
translated: Because the meaning is very well distinguished, it is a case ending.

original: t'a bhy'am // bhis gsum pa'o //🔽de bhy'am ; bhyas bzhi pa'o //🔽da si ; bhy'am /
analyzed: t'a bhy'am // bhis gsum pa'o // de bhy'am ; bhyas bzhi pa'o // da si ; bhy'am /
translated: In that, the first is with si, the second with aṃ, the third with ṭha,

original: byas lnga pa'o ;🔽/ ngas aos ;🔽a'a ma drug pa'o //
analyzed: byas lnga pa'o ; / ngas aos ; a'a ma drug pa'o //
translated: the fourth with ṇa, the fifth with ṇa,

original: ngi aos su pra bdun pa'o //
analyzed: ngi aos su pra bdun pa'o //
translated: the sixth with ṅa, and the seventh with ṅa.

original: de la thams cad du si la sogs pa rnams thob pa la rtags kyi don gyi tshig la rnam dbye dang po'o zhes pas dang po'i rnam dbyer 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de la thams cad du si la sogs pa rnams thob pa la rtags kyi don gyi tshig la rnam dbye dang po'o zhes pas dang po'i rnam dbyer 'gyur ro /
translated: In that, the first case ending is formed by the first case ending in the word for the meaning of the sign, which is obtained everywhere by si and so on.

original: de'ang don gcig la gcig gi tshig si'o //
analyzed: de'ang don gcig la gcig gi tshig si'o //
translated: Moreover, the word for the single meaning is si.

original: rim pa las ma 'das par phral bar bya'o /
analyzed: rim pa las ma 'das par phral bar bya'o /
translated: It should be separated without transgressing the order.

original: ai yig ni 'dir gang rjes su 'brel ba rnams mi sbyor ro zhes pas khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: ai yig ni 'dir gang rjes su 'brel ba rnams mi sbyor ro zhes pas khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The letter i here has the meaning of a restrictive particle, which is not to be combined with whatever follows.

original: rdzogs pa la yang na'o zhes pa sbyir btang nas re pha dang sa dag gi rnam par gcad bya'o zhes pas sa yig ni rna par gcad bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa la yang na'o zhes pa sbyir btang nas re pha dang sa dag gi rnam par gcad bya'o zhes pas sa yig ni rna par gcad bya'o //
translated: The letter sa is to be deleted, as stated in the general rule Also in the perfect, and in the particular rule Of the letters ra and sa.🔽The word both has the dual ending oṃ.

original: s'urya:/ gnyis kyi don dag la gnyis kyi tshig aoo'o //🔽rim pa las ma 'das par phral @55a * //
analyzed: s'urya:/ gnyis kyi don dag la gnyis kyi tshig aoo'o // rim pa las ma 'das par phral @55a * //
translated: The word two is to be understood as two times, and the word four as four times.🔽The word four is to be understood as four times, and the word eight as eight times.🔽The word eight is to be understood as eight times, and the word sixteen as sixteen times.

original: bar bya'o // ao yig la aoo ste aoo yig la'ang ngo zhe pas aoo yig tu 'gyur te pha rol dbi ba'ang 'thob bo //🔽gsal byed dbyangs med pa pha rol gyi yi ger drang ngo //
analyzed: bar bya'o // ao yig la aoo ste aoo yig la'ang ngo zhe pas aoo yig tu 'gyur te pha rol dbi ba'ang 'thob bo // gsal byed dbyangs med pa pha rol gyi yi ger drang ngo //
translated: The word sixteen is to be understood as sixteen times, and the word thirty-two as thirty-two times.🔽The word thirty-two is to be understood as thirty-two times, and the word sixty-four as sixty-four times.

original: s'ur++yoo / mang po'i don rnams la mang po'i tshig dzas so //🔽aa yig phral bar bya'o //
analyzed: s'ur++yoo / mang po'i don rnams la mang po'i tshig dzas so // aa yig phral bar bya'o //
translated: The word sixty-four is to be understood as sixty-four times, and the word one hundred and twenty-eight as one hundred and twenty-eight times.🔽The word one hundred and twenty-eight is to be understood as one hundred and twenty-eight times, and the word two hundred and fifty-six as two hundred and fifty-six times.

original: dza yig ni rdzas la'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: dza yig ni rdzas la'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The word two hundred and fifty-six is to be understood as two hundred and fifty-six times, and the word five hundred and twelve as five hundred and twelve times.🔽The word five hundred and twelve is to be understood as five hundred and twelve times, and the word one thousand two hundred and twenty-four as one thousand two hundred and twenty-four times.

original: aa yig la dbyi'o zhes pas dbyi ba thob pa la aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes sbyir btang nas dzas la'o zhes pas ring por thob cing ring po las pha rol dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa yig la dbyi'o zhes pas dbyi ba thob pa la aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes sbyir btang nas dzas la'o zhes pas ring por thob cing ring po las pha rol dbyi'o //
translated: sūryāḥ

original: s'ur++y'a:/ gnyis pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa rnam lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas las la gnyis par 'gyur te /
analyzed: s'ur++y'a:/ gnyis pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa rnam lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas las la gnyis par 'gyur te /
translated: The remaining words in the second line are to be understood as follows. The word karma is in the second case, by the rule karma and kriyā are in the second case, and so on.

original: snga ma bzhin du don gcig la gcig gi tshig aam mo //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du don gcig la gcig gi tshig aam mo //
translated: As before, the words have the same meaning.

original: aa yig la dbyi'o zhes pas aa yig dbyi ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: aa yig la dbyi'o zhes pas aa yig dbyi ba 'thob bo //
translated: The letter a is elided by the rule a is elided, and the letter a is elided.

original: s'ur++ya ma s'ur++yo //🔽sha yig ni shas la ste sa'i 'ang na'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to /🔽'di nyid kyis aa yig ring por 'thob ste /
analyzed: s'ur++ya ma s'ur++yo // sha yig ni shas la ste sa'i 'ang na'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to / 'di nyid kyis aa yig ring por 'thob ste /
translated: sūryasūryāḥ

original: ring po las pha rol dbyi zhing sa'ang na yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring po las pha rol dbyi zhing sa'ang na yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The letter śa is elided by the rule śa and sa are elided, and the letter sa is elided by the rule sa is elided, and the letter a is elided by the rule from a long syllable, a is elided, and the letter sa is elided by the rule sa is elided, and the letter a is elided by the rule a is elided.🔽 raśmiḥ

original: ra dang sha dang ri'i yi ge rnams las zhes pa la sogs pas na nyid 'thob pa la /
analyzed: ra dang sha dang ri'i yi ge rnams las zhes pa la sogs pas na nyid 'thob pa la /
translated: By the rule from the letters ra, śa, and ri, the letter na is obtained.

original: mtha' ma yin pa zhes smos pas mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtha' ma yin pa zhes smos pas mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The word not is not used, because it is the last.🔽Sūryānana,

original: s'ur++y'a na / gsum pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas byed pa la gsum pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: s'ur++y'a na / gsum pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas byed pa la gsum pa 'gyur te /
translated: when the meaning of the third is to be expressed, the third is formed by the remaining ones, such as 'kṛtya' and 'kṛti', etc.

original: gcig nyid la 'brel ba mi sbyir ro zhe pa'i khyad par ri sogs pa'i don rnams la gcig gi tshig t'a'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid la 'brel ba mi sbyir ro zhe pa'i khyad par ri sogs pa'i don rnams la gcig gi tshig t'a'o //
translated: The word one is not connected to the meanings of the special cases such as kṛtya and so on.

original: t'a yig las a' yig phral bar bya ste /
analyzed: t'a yig las a' yig phral bar bya ste /
translated: The letter 'ā' should be separated from the letter 'tā'.

original: t'a yig ni ai na t'a'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la //
analyzed: t'a yig ni ai na t'a'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la //
translated: The letter 'tā' is the meaning of the special case 'kṛtyā'.

original: ai nar ta'o zhes pas ai nar 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: ai nar ta'o zhes pas ai nar 'gyur zhing //
translated: By 'kṛnt', it becomes 'kṛnti'.

original: aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae ste pha rol yang dbyi ba thob la //
analyzed: aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae ste pha rol yang dbyi ba thob la //
translated: The letter 'ā' is the letter 'i' for the letter 'ai', and the other is also obtained by elision.

original: ra dang sha dang ri'i yi ge rnams las zhes pa la sogs bas na nyid do //
analyzed: ra dang sha dang ri'i yi ge rnams las zhes pa la sogs bas na nyid do //
translated: By from the letters ra, śa, and ri, etc., it is one.🔽Sūryānana,

original: s'ur++ya na / aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhe spas aa yig ring por thob bo /
analyzed: s'ur++ya na / aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhe spas aa yig ring por thob bo /
translated: by the special case of the long vowel for the letter 'a' with the sound, the letter 'a' is obtained as long.

original: s'ur++y'a bhya' ma /
analyzed: s'ur++y'a bhya' ma /
translated: Sūryābhyām.

original: bhis aees yang na'o zhes pas bhis aees su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bhis aees yang na'o zhes pas bhis aees su 'gyur zhing /
translated: The ai of bhisai becomes ai by the rule ai and ai are ai and ai.

original: ae yig la ee ste aee yig la yang ngo zhes pas s'ur++yee:/
analyzed: ae yig la ee ste aee yig la yang ngo zhes pas s'ur++yee:/
translated: The e of surye becomes ai by the rule e and ai are ai and ai.

original: bzhi pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa la bzhi pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa la bzhi pa 'gyur te /
translated: When one wishes to express the meaning of the fourth, by the remaining [rules] such as action and agent, the fourth is obtained in samyakpradāne.

original: don gcig la gcig gi tshig nge'o //
analyzed: don gcig la gcig gi tshig nge'o //
translated: One word is the word of another.

original: da yi ge ni nge ya'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don te /
analyzed: da yi ge ni nge ya'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don te /
translated: The meaning of the special [rule] is the letter da is da.

original: 'di nyid kyang ya yig tu'ang 'gyur la /🔽aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pas aa yig ring por thob bo //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyang ya yig tu'ang 'gyur la / aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pas aa yig ring por thob bo //
translated: This very [rule] also applies to the letter ya, and

original: s'u r++y'a ya /
analyzed: s'u r++y'a ya /
translated: by the rule the long [vowel] of the letter a has the sound of a, the letter a is obtained as long.🔽Surya-ya,

original: s'u r++y'a bhy'a ma /
analyzed: s'u r++y'a bhy'a ma /
translated: surya-bhaya-m,

original: dhu ta ma po nyid la ni aae'o @55b zhes pas ae nyid do //
analyzed: dhu ta ma po nyid la ni aae'o @55b zhes pas ae nyid do //
translated: and in the case of dhuta-ma-po, the e becomes ai by the rule e and ai are ai and ai, so it is just ai.🔽Surya-bhyah,🔽 When one wishes to express the meaning of the fifth, by the remaining [rules] such as action and agent, the fifth is obtained in mahabhuta.

original: s'u r++ye bhya:/ lnga pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'byung khungs la lnga pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: s'u r++ye bhya:/ lnga pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas 'byung khungs la lnga pa 'gyur te /
translated: Sūryya,🔽when the meaning of the fifth is desired to be expressed, from the rest, action, agent, etc., the fifth case is formed for the source.🔽

original: don gcig la gcig gi tshig nga si'o //
analyzed: don gcig la gcig gi tshig nga si'o //
translated: The same meaning is expressed by the word of one [case] for the other.

original: si yig las ai yig phral bar bya ste /
analyzed: si yig las ai yig phral bar bya ste /
translated: The vowel i is to be removed from the syllable si.

original: nga si ngas dag gi aa au'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la /
analyzed: nga si ngas dag gi aa au'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la /
translated: The meaning of the special case of nga and si is ā and au.

original: nga si a' ta to zhe pas a' ta te mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring por 'gyur zhing pha rol yang dbyi'o zhes pas pha rol dbyi'o //
analyzed: nga si a' ta to zhe pas a' ta te mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring por 'gyur zhing pha rol yang dbyi'o zhes pas pha rol dbyi'o //
translated: By the rule nga si ā ta ta, ā ta becomes long, and by the rule paraṃ dīrghaḥ, the other [vowel] is long.

original: s'u r++y'a ta /
analyzed: s'u r++y'a ta /
translated: Sau-ryā-ta.

original: aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pas ring po'o s'ur++y'a bhy'a ma /
analyzed: aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pas ring po'o s'ur++y'a bhy'a ma /
translated: By the rule a-ya-dīrghaḥ, the long [vowel] is long. Sau-ryā-bhyām.

original: snga ma bzhin du ae nyid do //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ae nyid do //
translated: As before, it is e itself.🔽Sau-ryebhyaḥ.

original: s'ur++ye bhya: // drug pa'i don brjod par 'dad pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas bdag po la sogs pa la drug pa 'gyur te don gcig la cig gi tshig ngas so //
analyzed: s'ur++ye bhya: // drug pa'i don brjod par 'dad pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas bdag po la sogs pa la drug pa 'gyur te don gcig la cig gi tshig ngas so //
translated: When the meaning of the sixth [case] is intended, by the rule śeṣād bhavati karttṛ-ādiṣu, the sixth case is formed for the agent and so on. The same meaning is expressed by the word of one [case] for the other.

original: ngas kyi aa yig phral ba bya ste /
analyzed: ngas kyi aa yig phral ba bya ste /
translated: The vowel a of nga is to be removed.

original: nga yig ni ngas sya'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la /
analyzed: nga yig ni ngas sya'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la /
translated: The syllable nga is the meaning of the special case of nga-sya.

original: 'di nyid kyis ngas sya ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ngas sya ru 'gyur ro //
translated: By this very [rule], it becomes nga-sya.

original: s'u r++ya sya /
analyzed: s'u r++ya sya /
translated: Surya-

original: aos la'ang ngo zhe pas ae nyid de ae aa ya'o //🔽s'u r++ya yo: thung ngu na d'i shraddh'a rnams las si dbyi'o zhes pa sbyir btang nas /
analyzed: aos la'ang ngo zhe pas ae nyid de ae aa ya'o // s'u r++ya yo: thung ngu na d'i shraddh'a rnams las si dbyi'o zhes pa sbyir btang nas /
translated: The letter E is the same as the letter O. The letter E is the letter A.🔽 The letter S is the letter I.

original: a'a ma la'ang nu'o zhes pas nu a'a ga ma ste /
analyzed: a'a ma la'ang nu'o zhes pas nu a'a ga ma ste /
translated: The letter U is the letter N. The letter A is the letter M.

original: au yig ni gsum pa la sogs pa la ni pha rol gyi dang por ro zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la //
analyzed: au yig ni gsum pa la sogs pa la ni pha rol gyi dang por ro zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la //
translated: The letter U is the third and so on. The letter U is the first of the other. This is the meaning of the special rule.

original: aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pas ring po nyid do /
analyzed: aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pas ring po nyid do /
translated: The letter A is long. The letter A is long.

original: s'ur++y'a n'am ; bdun pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: s'ur++y'a n'am ; bdun pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na /
translated: The letter S is the seventh. The meaning of the seventh is desired to be expressed.

original: lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas gzhi la bdun pa 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas gzhi la bdun pa 'gyur te /
translated: The remaining ones are the basis. The seventh is changed by the rule kṛtya and so on.

original: don gcig la gcig gi tshig ngi'o /
analyzed: don gcig la gcig gi tshig ngi'o /
translated: The word of one meaning is ṅi.

original: ngi yig las ai yig phral bar bya ste /
analyzed: ngi yig las ai yig phral bar bya ste /
translated: The letter Ṇ is separated from the letter Ṇ.

original: ngi yig ni ngi snga ma dang bcas pa aoo'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la /
analyzed: ngi yig ni ngi snga ma dang bcas pa aoo'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don yin la /
translated: The letter Ṇ is the letter Ṇ along with the previous. The letter Ṇ is the letter Ṇ. This is the meaning of the special rule.

original: a'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae ste pha rol yang dbyi'o /

analyzed: phyogs la ni / na&amp ; med pa'i aarban ni si ma yin pa la aar banti'o zhes pa sbyir btang nas si la'ang ma gha wan ni ma gha wantu yang na'o zhes pas ma gha ban gyi sgra ni ma gha banta ru 'gyur zhing /
translated: In the case of directions,🔽na, a, and the absence of a,🔽in general, arvan means “to be,” and in particular, it means “to be” in the case of a, and it means “to be” in the case of Maghavan.

analyzed: gsal byed las kyang zhes pas si dbyi'o // be dh'a:/ be dha soo /

original: a'a ga ma aut rjes su 'brel pa zhes pa la sogs pas au yig dbyi zhing ghut la'ang sam buddhi ma yin pa la zhes pas ring po kho na'o //

analyzed: bud med la aa las a'a'o zhes pas a'a'i rkyen te /

original: mtshungs pa las ring po dang ring po pha rol dbyi ba'ang ngo //
analyzed: mtshungs pa las ring po dang ring po pha rol dbyi ba'ang ngo //
translated: From the equal, the long, and from the long, the opposite is also yi.

original: a'a shraddh'a'o zhes pas shraddha'i ming can te /
analyzed: a'a shraddh'a'o zhes pas shraddha'i ming can te /
translated: Āśraddhā has the name of śraddhā.

original: shraddh'a las si dbyi'o zhes pas si dbyi'o //
analyzed: shraddh'a las si dbyi'o zhes pas si dbyi'o //
translated: From śraddhā, it is said si, yi, so it is siyi.

original: dza y'a / aoo a'i'o zhes pas aoo yig ni a'i yig tu thob cing /
analyzed: dza y'a / aoo a'i'o zhes pas aoo yig ni a'i yig tu thob cing /
translated: Jayā. It is said au, ai, so the letter au is obtained as the letter ai.

original: aa'i yi ge ai'i ye ge la ae ste pha rol dbyi ba'ang ngo //
analyzed: aa'i yi ge ai'i ye ge la ae ste pha rol dbyi ba'ang ngo //
translated: The letter ai is the letter i, and the opposite is also e.

original: dza ye / ring po las pha rol dbyi ba thob po //🔽dza y'a:/ dza y'am /
analyzed: dza ye / ring po las pha rol dbyi ba thob po // dza y'a:/ dza y'am /

original: dz'a ye / dz'a y'a:/
analyzed: dz'a ye / dz'a y'a:/
translated: Jaye. Jayāṃ.

original: t'a aos dag la ae'o zhes pas ae nyid de /
analyzed: t'a aos dag la ae'o zhes pas ae nyid de /
translated: The vowels are purified by āḥ.🔽

original: ae aa ya'o //🔽dza y'a y'a /
analyzed: ae aa ya'o // dza y'a y'a /
translated: The a of ta becomes e by the rule: The a of the pure becomes e by the addition of o.🔽 The a of a becomes e.

original: dza y'a bhy'am /
analyzed: dza y'a bhy'am /
translated: Jayaya, jayabham, jayabhiḥ.

original: dza y'a bhi:/ nga ldan rnams yee y'as y'as y'am'o zhes pas nga ldan gyi brjod pa rnams ni yee dang y'as dang y'as dang y'am rnams su 'gyur bas nge gnas pa na yee ru 'gyur ro //🔽dz'a y'a yee /🔽dz'a y'a bhy'am /
analyzed: dza y'a bhi:/ nga ldan rnams yee y'as y'as y'am'o zhes pas nga ldan gyi brjod pa rnams ni yee dang y'as dang y'as dang y'am rnams su 'gyur bas nge gnas pa na yee ru 'gyur ro // dz'a y'a yee / dz'a y'a bhy'am /
translated: The a of the first syllable of the words with the case endings becomes e, the a becomes a, the a becomes a, and the a becomes am. Thus, when the locative case is used, the a becomes e.🔽 Jayaye, jayabham, jayabhiḥ.

original: dza y'a bhya:/ dza y'a y'a /🔽dza y'a bhy'am /🔽dza y'a bhya:/ dza y'a y'a:/
analyzed: dza y'a bhya:/ dza y'a y'a / dza y'a bhy'am / dza y'a bhya:/ dza y'a y'a:/
translated: Jayaya, jayabham, jayabhiḥ.🔽 Jayayaḥ, jayayoḥ, jayānām.

original: dza ya yo:/ dza y'a n'am /🔽dza y'a y'am /
analyzed: dza ya yo:/ dza y'a n'am / dza y'a y'am /
translated: Jayaya, jayayam, jayayoḥ.

original: dza ya yo:/ dza ya su /🔽kun du bod pa la ni ;
analyzed: dza ya yo:/ dza ya su / kun du bod pa la ni ;
translated: Jayaya, jayasu.

original: shraddh'a las zhes pa spyir btang ba la /
analyzed: shraddh'a las zhes pa spyir btang ba la /
translated: The general rule for the use of the case endings is:🔽From śraddhā, etc., the case endings are used.

original: sam buddhi la'ang ngo zhes pa ae nyid de /
analyzed: sam buddhi la'ang ngo zhes pa ae nyid de /
translated: The a of a becomes e by the rule: The a of the pure becomes e by the addition of o.

analyzed: pamkti:/ sirmma ti:/ ba li:/ su ram dhri:/ aanggu li:/ shre ni:/ mu r'a ri:/ ao sha dhi:/ kshi ti:/ r'a tri:/ na bhi:/ ra ni:/ aa le:/ ksha ti:/ d'ipti:/ d'i dh'i ti:/ a'a si:/ r'a ji / ra te:/ khy'a ste:/ dardvi:/ kam bi dhi:/ zhes pa la sogs pa rnams so / // / ba dhu'i sgra las si la sogs pa rnams ni / na d'i dang 'dra bar drang bar bya zhing / 'di ni khyad par te a'i yig mtha' las si dbyi ba med la / dbyangs dang po can la au'i yi ge la wa'o zhes pas au yig wa yig tu @69a * // thob bo // ba dh'u:/
translated: pamkti,🔽sirmanti, bali,🔽surandhri, anguli,🔽shreni, murari,🔽oshdhi, kshhiti,🔽ratri, nabhi,🔽rani, ale,🔽kshati, dipti, didhiti,🔽asi, rajani,🔽rati, khyastha,🔽dandvi, kamvidhi.🔽And so on.🔽The syllables si and so on, from the word badhu,🔽are to be derived like the word nanda.🔽The difference is that the si is not elided at the end of the ai,🔽and the first vowel is the letter u, and the letter u is the letter va.🔽Thus, the letter u is obtained as the letter va.🔽badhu.🔽
